Title: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an SQL Command
Mitigation: Use a whitelist to validate commands before they are processed. Sanitize input before processing it.

Title: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an SQL Command
Mitigation: Use a whitelist to validate commands before they are processed. Sanitize input before processing it.

Title: Expired Pointer Dereference
Mitigation: Ensure that pointers are initialized after declaration before they are dereferenced. Ensure that pointers are not dereferenced after previously valid memory locations become invalid.

Title: Expired Pointer Dereference
Mitigation: Ensure that pointers are initialized after declaration before they are dereferenced. Ensure that pointers are not dereferenced after previously valid memory locations become invalid.

Title: Improper Limitation of a Pathname to a Restricted Directory
Mitigation: Use a whitelist to validate commands before they are processed. Sanitize input before processing it.

Title: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an OS Command
Mitigation: Use a whitelist to validate commands before they are processed. Sanitize input before processing it.

Title: Integer Overflow or Wraparound
Mitigation: Validate the input before assigning it to a variable. Use libraries such as SafeInt or IntegerLib.

Title: Integer Overflow
Mitigation: Ensure that values being assigned are checked against the maximum or minimum value of the type to which they are being assigned
